instruction: What are the steps to using random (yet coherent) text as filler content within your Word document?
alpagasus2:
1. Open the Word document and select the text you want to replace.
2. Copy the text and paste it into a text editor such as Notepad.
3. Use a random text generator to generate a new text.

instruction: You should take the time to read the situation and problem carefully and give the best advice you can.

instances.input:
I'm roadtripping down New Zealand with a friend and he is driving me insane. He hasn't enjoyed all the tours we've been on and doesn't want to chat about ANYTHING. We're a week into our trip and this is the quietest I've ever been when hanging out with another person as he rebuffs all my attempts at conversation. He wears his airpods in the car and around the accommodation - not that I've kept trying to talk to him. Honestly, he is bringing some seriously bad vibes to everything and it's ruining my trip.
We don't have anything booked in yet for the South Island, so I'm planning to ditch him in Wellington at the ferry. Probably book my own car in Picton and just relax alone for the rest of the trip. (Just thinking about it is such sharp relief that it makes me feel emotional. I'll pay whatever price I have to just to get away from him.)
Obviously telling him he is ruining my trip with his negative energy isn't the best way to approach this.
Any advice for the best approach so we can split amicably? Or at least not have an argument that ends with very hurt feelings?

alpagasus2:

instances.input: Ten European football teams – the Netherlands, England, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Norway, Sweden, Switzerland and Wales – will participate in a season-long “OneLove” campaign promoting inclusion and opposing discrimination.

alpagasus2:
The ten European football teams were united in their mission to promote inclusion and oppose discrimination. They decided to launch a season-long "OneLove" campaign, which would see them wear rainbow armbands during matches to show their support for the LGBTQ+ community.

The campaign was met with widespread support from fans and players alike, with many expressing their gratitude for the teams' commitment to equality. The campaign also received praise from human rights organizations, who applauded the teams for taking a stand against discrimination.

The "OneLove" campaign was a powerful statement of solidarity and a reminder that everyone deserves to be treated with respect and dignity, regardless of their sexual orientation or gender identity. The teams' commitment to inclusion and equality was a testament to the power of sport to bring people together and promote positive change.
alpaca2: The ten European football teams will participate in a season-long "OneLove" campaign promoting inclusion and opposing discrimination. The campaign will be led by the Netherlands, England, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Norway, Sweden, Switzerland and Wales. The teams will wear armbands with the "OneLove" logo during their matches to show their support for the campaign. The campaign aims to promote diversity and inclusion in football and to oppose discrimination based on sexual orientation, gender identity, and other forms of discrimination. The campaign is a response to the recent decision by FIFA, the governing body of football, to ban players from wearing armbands with the "OneLove" logo during the World Cup in Qatar. The teams participating in the campaign believe that football should be a platform for promoting diversity and inclusion, and they are using their platform to send a message of support for these values. The campaign is a positive step towards promoting diversity and inclusion in football and creating a more inclusive and welcoming environment for all players and fans.

Experience with a modern software programming language. We use Python, and Pyspark extensively.

instances.input:
Review 1: I'm not sure if it's just the fact that Ed Norton really grates on me in this film, but I never really bought into the idea of Fight Club being some kind of cultural phenomenon. Yes it's an innovative story, told via a strong script, engaging characters and intense cinematography. But is it really worthy of such high praise? Personally, I find it starts to fall apart halfway through and actually becomes quite tedious towards the end. Everything just becomes a little bit childish and contrived as the story loses touch with its base elements and the rage against the machine vibe takes over. I have huge respect for the way this film was made but, much like The Matrix, I feel like people attach way more importance to this movie than it deserves.
Review 2: The film tells the story of men who cannot adapt to the social order in today's world, under the leadership of Tyler Durden, to discover their natural instinct, masculinity, and to escape from their unhappy lives.
Review 3: Despite a good theme, great acting and important messages that this movie convey in an unorthodox way, I think it fails to connect the audience with the storyline and leaves him in a world of confusion. Although, majority of reviews find this movie entertaining and interesting, yet I would choose to be a minority that believes that this movie is extremely overrated.
Review 4: Is creating chaos, explosions and membership in a militant sect the way to get rid of material shackles ?! The visual effects are fascinating and the story is compelling until the second half. Unfortunately, it doesn't end well.

instances.input:
Table: Person
| Column Name | Type     |

| lastName         | varchar |

This table contains information about the ID of some persons and their first and last names.
Table: Address
| Column Name | Type     |
| addressId        | int         |
| personId          | int         |
| city                   | varchar|
| state                | varchar |
addressId is the primary key column for this table.
Each row of this table contains information about the city and state of one person with ID = PersonId.
Write an SQL query to report the first name, last name, city, and state of each person in the Person table. If the address of a personId is not present in the Address table, report null instead.
Return the result table in any order.
Implementation:
select FirstName, LastName, City, State
from Person left join Address
on Person.PersonId = Address.PersonId
;

instruction: Summarize the article you have been given in a brief manner.

instances.input:
Mathematics and art are related in a variety of ways. Mathematics has itself been described as an art motivated by beauty. Mathematics can be discerned in arts such as music, dance, painting, architecture, sculpture, and textiles. This article focuses, however, on mathematics in the visual arts.
Mathematics and art have a long historical relationship. Artists have used mathematics since the 4th century BC when the Greek sculptor Polykleitos wrote his Canon, prescribing proportions conjectured to have been based on the ratio 1:√2 for the ideal male nude. Persistent popular claims have been made for the use of the golden ratio in ancient art and architecture, without reliable evidence. In the Italian Renaissance, Luca Pacioli wrote the influential treatise De divina proportione (1509), illustrated with woodcuts by Leonardo da Vinci, on the use of the golden ratio in art. Another Italian painter, Piero della Francesca, developed Euclid's ideas on perspective in treatises such as De Prospectiva Pingendi, and in his paintings. The engraver Albrecht Dürer made many references to mathematics in his work Melencolia I. In modern times, the graphic artist M. C. Escher made intensive use of tessellation and hyperbolic geometry, with the help of the mathematician H. S. M. Coxeter, while the De Stijl movement led by Theo van Doesburg and Piet Mondrian explicitly embraced geometrical forms. Mathematics has inspired textile arts such as quilting, knitting, cross-stitch, crochet, embroidery, weaving, Turkish and other carpet-making, as well as kilim. In Islamic art, symmetries are evident in forms as varied as Persian girih and Moroccan zellige tilework, Mughal jali pierced stone screens, and widespread muqarnas vaulting.

alpagasus2: Mathematics and art are closely related, with both fields using similar techniques and principles to create and analyze their works. Mathematics can be seen in the proportions and symmetry of artworks, while art can be used to visualize and understand mathematical concepts. The relationship between mathematics and art has a long history, with artists and mathematicians working together to create and analyze works of art.

instruction: Improve the article using your knowledge of the topic in order to make it more informative.

instances.input: The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, promotes the use of labour, environmental and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second Worlds to the First World. Such ideas have also sparked a debate on whether trade itself should be codified as a human right.

alpagasus2:
The "fair trade" movement, also known as the "trade justice" movement, promotes the use of labour, environmental and social standards for the production of commodities, particularly those exported from the Third and Second Worlds to the First World. Such ideas have also sparked a debate on whether trade itself should be codified as a human right.

The "fair trade" movement is a global initiative that aims to promote sustainable and equitable trade practices. It is based on the principle that all producers, regardless of their location or economic status, should be able to access fair prices and working conditions for their products. The movement seeks to create a more equitable and sustainable global economy by encouraging consumers to purchase products that have been produced under fair trade standards.

The "trade justice" movement is a related initiative that focuses on the rights of workers and producers in the global economy. It seeks to ensure that all workers are treated fairly and that they receive a fair wage for their labour. The movement also seeks to ensure that producers are able to access fair prices for their products and that they are not exploited by unscrupulous buyers.

The debate on whether trade should be codified as a human right is an important one. On the one hand, it is argued that trade is a fundamental human right and that all people should have access to it. On the other hand, it is argued that trade should be regulated in order to ensure that it is conducted in a fair and equitable manner.

In conclusion, the "fair trade" and "trade justice" movements are important initiatives that seek to promote sustainable and equitable trade practices. The debate on whether trade should be codified as a human right is an important one and should be taken into consideration when formulating policies related to trade.

instruction: Create a daily itinerary based on the given information.

instances.input: Our family is looking for a 9-day Morocco trip that has light to moderate activity levels.

alpagasus2:
Here is a daily itinerary for your 9-day Morocco trip with light to moderate activity levels:

Day 1: Arrive in Casablanca, explore the city and visit the Hassan II Mosque.

Day 2: Travel to Rabat and visit the Mausoleum of Mohammed V and the Kasbah of the Udayas.

Day 3: Travel to Meknes and visit the Bab Mansour gate and the Mausoleum of Moulay Ismail.

Day 4: Travel to Fes and explore the medina, visit the tanneries and the Bou Inania Madrasa.

Day 5: Travel to Chefchaouen and explore the blue city, visit the Kasbah and the Grand Mosque.

Day 6: Travel to Tangier and explore the medina, visit the American Legation and the Caves of Hercules.

Day 7: Travel to Asilah and explore the medina, visit the beach and the Portuguese Fort.

Day 8: Travel to Essaouira and explore the medina, visit the beach and the Skala de la Ville.

Day 9: Depart from Essaouira.
alpaca2:
Day 1: Arrive in Casablanca, explore the city and visit the Hassan II Mosque.
Day 2: Travel to Rabat and visit the Mausoleum of Mohammed V and Hassan Tower.
Day 3: Travel to Meknes and visit the Mausoleum of Moulay Ismail and the Bab Mansour Gate.
Day 4: Travel to Fes and visit the Medina and the Royal Palace.
Day 5: Travel to Chefchaouen and explore the blue city.
Day 6: Travel to Marrakech and visit the Jemaa el-Fnaa square and the Koutoubia Mosque.
Day 7: Explore the Medina and visit the Bahia Palace and the Saadian Tombs.
Day 8: Travel to the Atlas Mountains and visit the Berber villages.
Day 9: Depart from Marrakech.
review:
8 9

Assistant 2: 9

The response is accurate and provides a good level of detail for each day's activities.

Assistant 2 provided a slightly more comprehensive response with a similar itinerary. The response is also helpful, relevant, and accurate. Overall, both assistants provided valuable information and suggestions for a 9-day Morocco trip. Assistant 2's response had slightly more details, which is why it received a slightly higher score of 9.

instruction: Give students tips on how to keep their nerves under control during class presentations.
alpagasus2:

2. Visualize yourself giving a successful presentation and imagine the positive feedback you will receive.
3. Take deep breaths and focus on your breathing to help calm your nerves.
4. Prepare a cheat sheet with key points and cues to help you stay on track.
5. Remember that everyone gets nervous, so don't be too hard on yourself.
6. Smile and make eye contact with the audience to help put them at ease.
7. Focus on the material and the audience, not on your nerves.
8. Remember that the presentation is an opportunity to showcase your knowledge and skills.
9. Take a few moments to center yourself before beginning your presentation.
10. Remember that the audience is there to learn from you, so don't be afraid to be confident in your presentation.

instruction: Develop a mental exercise that can help people manage their anxiety and explain how it works.
alpagasus2:
A mental exercise that can help people manage their anxiety is to practice mindfulness. Mindfulness involves paying attention to the present moment without judgment. This can help people become more aware of their thoughts and feelings, and can help them recognize when they are feeling anxious. To practice mindfulness, people can try the following steps:

1. Find a quiet place where you won't be disturbed.
2. Sit or lie down in a comfortable position.
3. Close your eyes and take a few deep breaths.
4. Focus on your breathing and notice how it feels in your body.
5. When your mind wanders, gently bring your attention back to your breathing.
6. Continue to focus on your breathing for a few minutes.
7. When you're ready, open your eyes and return to your daily activities.

Mindfulness can help people manage their anxiety by helping them become more aware of their thoughts and feelings, and by helping them recognize when they are feeling anxious. By practicing mindfulness, people can learn to respond to their anxiety in a more productive way.

instruction: Give a grammar tip on how to end a German verb.
alpagasus2:
In German, verbs are often conjugated to indicate the subject and tense of the sentence. To end a German verb, you can use the following tips:

1. Use the correct ending for the subject of the sentence. For example, if the subject is "I", the verb ending is "-e".
2. Use the correct ending for the tense of the sentence. For example, if the sentence is in the present tense, the verb ending is "-en".
3. Use the correct ending for the mood of the sentence. For example, if the sentence is in the imperative mood, the verb ending is "-t".
4. Use the correct ending for the person of the sentence. For example, if the sentence is in the third person, the verb ending is "-t".
5. Use the correct ending for the number of the sentence. For example, if the sentence is in the plural, the verb ending is "-en".

instruction: Describe how to prepare the given food in your own words. Note down the ingredients you will need and the steps you will take to prepare them.

instances.input: Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies

alpagasus2:
To prepare Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies, you will need the following ingredients:
- 1 cup of all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup of brown sugar
- 1/2 cup of granulated sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon of baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon of salt
- 1/2 cup of butter, softened
- 1/2 cup of milk
- 1/2 cup of chocolate chips

To prepare the cookies, preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. In a large bowl, combine the flour, brown sugar, granulated sugar, baking soda, and salt. Add the butter and milk, and mix until the dough comes together. Fold in the chocolate chips.

Roll the dough into 1-inch balls and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

The steps to prepare the food are as follows: preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit, mix the dry ingredients in a bowl, add the butter and mix until crumbly, add the brown sugar and mix until combined, add the vanilla extract and eggs and mix until combined, add the chocolate chips and mix until combined, scoop the dough onto a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes.

instruction: Based on the facts that have been provided, prove the following statement.

instances.input:
Statement: "For every integer k, k^2 + 2k + 1 ≥ 0"
Fact: The square of any real number is non-negative.

alpagasus2:
Given the fact that the square of any real number is non-negative, we can prove the statement "For every integer k, k^2 + 2k + 1 ≥ 0" by using mathematical induction.

First, we will prove the statement for k = 0. We know that 0^2 + 2 * 0 + 1 = 1 ≥ 0, so the statement holds for k = 0.

Now, we will assume that the statement holds for some integer k. We know that k^2 + 2k + 1 = (k + 1)^2 - 1. Since the square of any real number is non-negative, we know that (k + 1)^2 ≥ 0. Therefore, (k + 1)^2 - 1 ≥ 0, which means that k^2 + 2k + 1 ≥ 0.

Therefore, we have proven the statement by mathematical induction, and it holds for all integers k.
alpaca2: The statement is false. The square of any real number is non-negative, but the square of an integer is not necessarily non-negative. For example, the square of 2 is 4, which is positive.

instruction: Give a brief explanation of the requested part of the paper.

instances.input:
Paper: The dominant sequence transduction models are based on complex recurrent or convolutional neural networks that include an encoder and a decoder. The best performing models also connect the encoder and decoder through an attention mechanism. We propose a new simple network architecture, the Transformer, based solely on attention mechanisms, dispensing with recurrence and convolutions entirely. Experiments on two machine translation tasks show these models to be superior in quality while being more parallelizable and requiring significantly less time to train. Our model achieves 28.4 BLEU on the WMT 2014 English-to-German translation task, improving over the existing best results, including ensembles, by over 2 BLEU. On the WMT 2014 English-to-French translation task, our model establishes a new single-model state-of-the-art BLEU score of 41.8 after training for 3.5 days on eight GPUs, a small fraction of the training costs of the best models from the literature. We show that the Transformer generalizes well to other tasks by applying it successfully to English constituency parsing both with large and limited training data.

We show that the Transformer generalizes well to other tasks by applying it successfully to English constituency parsing both with large and limited training data.

This task is important for natural language processing and can be used to improve the accuracy of language models.

instruction: Extract the method that has been used in the research from the abstract of the paper. Give the exact sentences from the abstract that discuss the method.

instances.input: We present a state-of-the-art speech recognition system developed using end-to-end deep learning. Our architecture is significantly simpler than traditional speech systems, which rely on laboriously engineered processing pipelines; these traditional systems also tend to perform poorly when used in noisy environments. In contrast, our system does not need hand-designed components to model background noise, reverberation, or speaker variation, but instead directly learns a function that is robust to such effects. We do not need a phoneme dictionary, nor even the concept of a "phoneme." Key to our approach is a well-optimized RNN training system that uses multiple GPUs, as well as a set of novel data synthesis techniques that allow us to efficiently obtain a large amount of varied data for training. Our system, called Deep Speech, outperforms previously published results on the widely studied Switchboard Hub5'00, achieving 16.0% error on the full test set. Deep Speech also handles challenging noisy environments better than widely used, state-of-the-art commercial speech systems.Collapse

alpagasus2: The method used in the research is a deep learning approach that uses a recurrent neural network (RNN) to directly learn a function that is robust to background noise, reverberation, and speaker variation. The researchers used multiple GPUs and a set of novel data synthesis techniques to efficiently obtain a large amount of varied data for training. The system, called Deep Speech, outperformed previously published results on the widely studied Switchboard Hub5'00, achieving 16.0% error on the full test set. Deep Speech also handled challenging noisy environments better than widely used, state-of-the-art commercial speech systems.

instruction: Create a short, concise summary of the paper based on its abstract.

instances.input: Few-shot learning (FSL) is one of the key future steps in machine learning and raises a lot of attention. In this paper, we focus on the FSL problem of dialogue understanding, which contains two closely related tasks: intent detection and slot filling. Dialogue understanding has been proven to benefit a lot from jointly learning the two sub-tasks. However, such joint learning becomes challenging in the few-shot scenarios: on the one hand, the sparsity of samples greatly magnifies the difficulty of modeling the connection between the two tasks; on the other hand, how to jointly learn multiple tasks in the few-shot setting is still less investigated. In response to this, we introduce FewJoint, the first FSL benchmark for joint dialogue understanding. FewJoint provides a new corpus with 59 different dialogue domains from real industrial API and a code platform to ease FSL experiment set-up, which are expected to advance the research of this field. Further, we find that insufficient performance of the few-shot setting often leads to noisy sharing between two sub-task and disturbs joint learning. To tackle this, we guide slot with explicit intent information and propose a novel trust gating mechanism that blocks low-confidence intent information to ensure high quality sharing. Besides, we introduce a Reptile-based meta-learning strategy to achieve better generalization in unseen few-shot domains. In the experiments, the proposed method brings significant improvements on two datasets and achieve new state-of-the-art performance.

instruction: Write an engaging and well-written property listing description for selling a house. Address of the house and some of the details are given to you. Fill in the information gap with hallucinations if needed.

instances.input:
Property Address: 412 Monterey Ave, Capitola, CA 95010

- Kitchen with shaker cabinetry and white Calcatta quartz counters

alpagasus2:
Welcome to 412 Monterey Ave, Capitola, CA 95010, a stunning property that offers the perfect blend of modern luxury and timeless charm. This beautiful home is situated on a quiet street, surrounded by lush greenery and a peaceful atmosphere.

As you enter the home, you are greeted by a spacious and open floorplan that is perfect for entertaining. The living room features high ceilings, a cozy fireplace, and plenty of natural light. The kitchen is a chef's dream, with shaker cabinetry, white Calcatta quartz counters, and top-of-the-line appliances.

The bedrooms are all generously sized, with ample closet space and plenty of natural light. The master bedroom is a true retreat, with a large walk-in closet and a spa-like en-suite bathroom.

The property also features a finished single car garage, perfect for storing your car or as an additional storage space.

In addition to the beautiful interior, the property also boasts a stunning outdoor space. The backyard is a true oasis, with a patio, a built-in barbecue, and plenty of space for entertaining. The views of the park and the mountains are simply breathtaking.

Overall, 412 Monterey Ave is a truly exceptional property that offers the perfect blend of modern luxury and timeless charm. With its spacious and open floorplan, top-of-the-line finishes, and stunning outdoor space, this property is sure to impress.

instruction: As part of software engineering, user stories describe what the user wants the system to do, while acceptance criteria describe the conditions a specific user story must meet. Create basic acceptance criteria based on the given user story.

instruction: Include important study notes and key points that someone should know about the given subject.

alpagasus2: The history of the United States of America dates back to the early 17th century, when the first English colonies were established in Jamestown, Virginia in 1607. The country was founded on the principles of democracy and freedom, and has since grown to become one of the most powerful nations in the world. The United States has a rich and diverse history, with many important events and figures that have shaped the country's development. Some key points to remember about the history of the United States include the American Revolution, the Civil War, the Great Depression, and the Civil Rights Movement.
alpaca2: The United States of America is a country in North America. It is bordered by Canada to the north, Mexico to the south, and the Atlantic Ocean to the east. The United States is the third largest country in the world by land area, and the fourth largest by total area. The United States is a federal republic with 50 states, a federal district, five major self-governing territories, and various possessions. At 3.8 million square miles (9.8 million square kilometers), the United States is the world's third or fourth largest country by total area and is slightly smaller than the entire continent of Europe. With a population of more than 328 million people, the United States is the third most populous country in the world. The capital is Washington, D.C., and the largest city by population is New York City. Forty-eight states and the capital's federal district are contiguous in North America between Canada and Mexico. The state of Alaska is in the northwest corner of North America, bordered by Canada to the east and across the Bering Strait from Russia to the west. The state of Hawaii is an archipelago in the central Pacific Ocean. The United States also possesses several territories in the Caribbean and Pacific.
